intro: Anaphrenium paniculosum, commonly known as the panicled anaphrenium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that consist of small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Anaphrenium paniculosum is typically found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, sunny conditions.
